data.title: Ruud Lubbers
data.meta_description: A long time before it had acquired a name or form, Ruud Lubbers fell foul of the #MeToo movement. In 2003 the former Dutch prime minister, by then serving his
data.text:
A long time before it had acquired a name or form, Ruud Lubbers fell foul of the #MeToo movement. In 2003 the former Dutch prime minister, by then serving his third year as the United Nations commissioner for refugees, was accused of groping a senior American member of his staff, Cynthia Brzak, as she left his office in Geneva. The UN’s Office of Internal Oversight Services (OIOS) investigated and reported to Kofi Annan, the UN secretary general, who announced that the charge could not be substantiated, but reprimanded the 65-year-old nonetheless.

In early 2005 the OIOS report was leaked. It said that five women had testified against “Lewd Rubbers”, as he was known within the refugee agency, and that there had been a “pattern of
